refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The address element defines a single postal address. It does not contain information about a person who resides at the address.
Different countries have different address formatting conventions. Address formatting is controlled by the address.format parameter.

If an address cannot be specified using address's child elements (street, city, etc.), it may be specified in untagged format. In this case, the address will be formatted verbatim, with line breaks preserved.

refsect2.title: Parents
refsect2.para: address may be contained in these elements: <$PARENTS$>

listitem.para: A string used to uniquely identify an address. The address may then be referred to by this identifier.

refsect1.title: Examples

example.title: Untagged address
example.programlisting: <address>Reina #35, apt. 4a, e/ Gervasio y Escobar Ciudad de La Habana, CP 11900 CUBA </address>

literallayout.computeroutput: Reina #35, apt. 4a, e/ Gervasio y Escobar Ciudad de La Habana, CP 11900 CUBA

warning.para: You may have noticed that the XML for this address isn't indented as usual. This is because untagged addresses are formatted verbatim, and so any indentation would be preserved in the formatted address. The address text begins on the same line as the start tag for the same reason (we don't want a leading linebreak in the formatted address).

refsect1.para: For additional address examples, look at the XML files in the examples/addressing directory of the &library.name; distribution.
